newsitem.title: USA: Edison Intl sees nuclear unit down two weeks.
newsitem.headline: Edison Intl sees nuclear unit down two weeks.

text.p: Edison International's Southern California Edison Co expects the 1,080-megawatt (MW) unit 2 at the San Onofre nuclear plant to be out of service for two weeks, a company spokesman said Tuesday
The unit was taken off-line early Monday morning due to a leak in the reactor's coolant piping system.
"We will use the downtime for repairs and also to conduct some other maintenance work," said spokesman Ray Golden.
The San Onofre plant's other 1,070-MW unit 2 continues to operate, but the performance of its reactor coolant pump seals are being carefully monitored, Golden noted.
Edison hopes to keep unit 2 on-line until the Nov. 30 start of a scheduled refueling outage, but has said there is a chance the seals may need to be revamped before that time.
Golden added that the timeframe for unit 2's refueling outage has been extended to 70 days from an original 65-day schedule.

SoCal Edison has a 75 percent stake in the San Onofre plant, while San Diego Gas and Electric Co., a subsidiary of Enova Corp, owns 20 percent and municipal utilities share the remaining five percent.
